      • getNodeInputTypes

        public java.lang.String[][] getNodeInputTypes()
        This method should return an array of the data types accepted by specific nodes, with the node index providing the index for the array. For nodes not covered by the array, the types specified by getInputTypes() are assumed.
        Returns:
        an array of the input types for this unit

      • getInputTypes

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getInputTypes()
        This method should return an array of the data types accepted by nodes not specified in getNodeInputTypes (e.g. triana.types.VectorType). If no package is specified then triana.types is assumed.
        Returns:
        an array of the input types for this unit

      • getNodeOutputTypes

        public java.lang.String[][] getNodeOutputTypes()
        This method should return an array of the data types output by specific nodes, with the node index providing the index for the array. For nodes not covered by the array, the types specified by getOutputTypes() are assumed.
        Returns:
        an array of the input types for this unit

      • getOutputTypes

        public abstract java.lang.String[] getOutputTypes()
        This method should return an array of the data types output by nodes not specified in getNodeOutputTypes() (e.g. triana.types.VectorType). If no package is specified then triana.types is assumed.
        Returns:
        an array of the output types for this unit

      • init

        public void init()
        This function is called when the unit is first created. It should be over-ridden to initialise the tool properties (e.g. default number of nodes) and tool parameters.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This function is called when the reset is pressed on the gui. It restore the unit to its pre-start state.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        This function is called when the unit is deleted. It should be over-ridden to clean up the unit (e.g. close open files).

      • process

        public abstract void process()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        The main unit algorithm. This method should be implemented with the appropriate algorihtm for the unit (if no algorithm is implemented deadlock occurs).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • stopping

        public void stopping()
        This is called when the network is forcably stopped by the user. This should be over-ridden with the desired tasks.

      • getParameterType

        public java.lang.Object getParameterType(java.lang.String paramname)
        Returns:
        the type of a task parameter

      • defineParameter

        public void defineParameter(java.lang.String paramname,
                   java.lang.Object initvalue,
                   java.lang.String type)
        Defines the initial value and type of a parameter. If the parameter is already defined, such as when the unit is recreated from a serialized version, then nothing happens. This method should generally only be used in the init method. Note that a parameterUpdate call is not generated.

        The type of the parameter can either be:

        USER_ACCESSIBLE - The user is allowed to dynamically update the value INTERNAL - The parameter is hidden from the user TRANSIENT - The parameter is hidden from the user and does not get saved when the taskgraph is serialized

        Parameters:
        paramname - the name of the parameter
        initvalue - the value of the parameter (null if not defined)
        type - see above

      • isParameter

        public boolean isParameter(java.lang.String paramname)
        Returns:
        true if a parameter with the specified name is set

      • isInputAtNode

        public boolean isInputAtNode(int nodeNumber)
        Returns:
        true if there is data waiting on the specified node

      • getInputAtNode

        public java.lang.Object getInputAtNode(int nodeNumber)
        Returns the data at input node nodeNumber. If data is not ready, NOT_READY triana type is returned. If there is no cable connected to the input node the NOT_CONNECTED triana type is returned.
        Parameters:
        nodeNumber - the particular node you want to get the data from.

      • output

        public void output(java.lang.Object data)
        Outputs the data across all nodes. This passses the given data set to the first output node and then makes copies for any other output nodes. This method blocks until the data is successfully sent.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be sent

      • outputAtNode

        public void outputAtNode(int outputNode,
                java.lang.Object data)
        Outputs the data to the given node outputNode.. This method is used to set the data at each particular output node if this is necessary, otherwise use output to copy the data across all nodes. This method blocks until the data is successfully sent.
        Parameters:
        outputNode - the output node you wish to set
        data - the data to be sent

      • outputAtNode

        public void outputAtNode(int outputNode,
                java.lang.Object data,
                boolean blocking)
        Outputs the data to the given node outputNode. If specified this method blocks until the data is successfully sent (usual behaviour), otherwise, if non-blocking, isOutputSent() can be used to poll whether the data has been successfully sent.
        Parameters:
        outputNode - the output node you wish to set
        data - the data to be sent
        blocking - true if this method should block until the data is sent

      • isOutputSent

        public boolean isOutputSent(int outputNode)
        Returns:
        true if the data sent with an output call has reached its destination
        See Also:
        void outputAtNode(int outputNode, Object data, boolean blocking)

      • getClipIn

        public java.lang.Object getClipIn(java.lang.Object data,
                         java.lang.String name)
        Returns:
        the clip-in with the specified name that came attached to the the specified data item (null if not present). Only clip-ins for data that has been input in the current process can be retrieved.

        public void setHelpFileLocation(java.lang.String location)
        Convienience method for setting the default help file location. If only a filename is specified then the toolbox location + /help is assumed. All tools should have help files, which should be written in HTML.

        Convienience method that sets the parameter update policy for this unit. This method should only be called from within the init() method.

      • getOutputPolicy

        public java.lang.String getOutputPolicy()
        Covienience method that returns the output policy for this unit.

        Convienience method that sets the output policy for this unit. This method should only be called from within the init() method.

      • setGUIBuilderV2Info

        public void setGUIBuilderV2Info(java.lang.String info)

      • setParameterPanelClass

        public void setParameterPanelClass(java.lang.String classname)

        Covienience method that returns the custom parameter panel class used

      • setParameterPanelInstantiate

        public void setParameterPanelInstantiate(java.lang.String policy)
        Convienience method that sets the when the parameter panel is instantiated, either ON_USER_ACCESS or ON_TASK_INSTANTIATION. This method should only be called from within the init() method.

      • getParameterPanelInstantiate

        public java.lang.String getParameterPanelInstantiate()
        Covienience method that returns the custom parameter panel class used
